main event: An object brighter than the moon, resembling a parachute, was observed for about 30 minutes over Wilmington, North Carolina.
interesting points: The object was described as maneuvering and changing elevation., Sightings reported as coming from the sea, moving from northeast to southwest., It appeared yellow and luminous., A child used a telescope to observe the object and noted it was bouncing., The sighting was attributed to potentially being a polar orbital satellite or an intelligence orbital balloon.
sighted object: a bright object resembling a parachute
witness description: a truck driver and a student
